title: Educational Curriculum Intern - Supporting multi projects
requirements:
Istation is one of the nation’s leading providers of richly animated, game-like education technology. Our reading, math, and Spanish products are based on industry-leading research and aligned with educational standards nation-wide. Our adaptive curriculum allows students to receive differentiated instruction that increases in complexity as they master key concepts. As students complete the activities and assessments, teachers receive real-time data that can be used to develop lessons and group students according to abilities. Our award-winning programs are so successful in classrooms across the country that we have seen rapid and sustained growth.

Our Mission

Istation’s mission is to support educators, empower kids and change lives. We believe every student deserves to feel like a superhero. We know that teachers are often the wind beneath their capes. Our logo with a child wearing a red cape was inspired by this belief! It’s great to see how we’ve built a following of passionate, dedicated educators and students called the Red Cape Nation.

Istation is currently looking for an innovative and creative individual to fill the position of Educational Curriculum Intern. Although this is a highly collaborative role, you must be a self-starter who can thrive with limited supervision in a fast-paced environment.

Main Duties And Responsibilities
Assist with research and data analysts
Engaging, coordinating and monitoring multiple projects
Collaborate outside of core team to solve problems and share best practices
Be creative when generating instructional concepts, storylines, flowcharts, overview documents, and curriculum scripts for production
Be able to work independently and as part of a team to create interactive games, activities, and lessons
Other duties as assigned


Required Education
Currently pursuing a BS / BA degree from a four-year university and entering as a college Junior or Senior year. Must be working towards a degree in Education or completed similar course work.

The right person for this role will…
Show strong personal ownership and ability to set and meet high professional standards.
Be passionate about what you do every day.
Be detail-oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Possess an aptitude for high-level efficiency.
Have excellent time management skills.
Have strong problem-solving skills
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills.
Be personally responsible, accountable, punctual, and reliable.
Bilingual preferred

Position Details
3 days a week – an average of 15 hours per week
$15/hr
Reports to Director of Curriculum
Summer internship
The position will be based in Dallas, Texas, and in the corporate office location


Istation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status

Required Skills

Required Experience

title: Education and Curriculum Intern
requirements:
About our Organization
Indiana Phenology is a 503(c)3 nonprofit that empowers Hoosiers of all ages to participate in citizen science and facilitates engaging environmental education opportunities, to increase the depth and breadth of open phenological data. We help communities and individuals develop a deep connection to the land on which they live. We believe in the importance of environmental stewardship, natural exploration, open data, and lifelong learning.
Learn more about our organization at www.indianaphenology.org
 About the Position
The Education and Curriculum Intern reports directly to the Executive Director. This position was created to address a growing interest in our Schoolyard Phenology program. In this role, you will work remotely to assist the Executive Director in expanding, refining, and implementing the existing Schoolyard Phenology curriculum for use in public K-12 schools.
 As the Education and Curriculum Intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to various aspects of Indiana Phenology’s Schoolyard Phenology program such as curriculum development, training for classroom teachers, and onboarding for new schools. In addition, the Intern will participate in weekly phenology observation at a site of their choosing.
 Primary Responsibilities
Assist with training instructors in classroom techniques.
Research best education practices and strategies.
Develop curriculum for K-12 students.
Maintain database of potential and participating instructors.
Conduct outreach to schools.
Assist in various day-to-day operations.
 Requirements
Resident of Indiana or student of an institution of higher education in Indiana.
Junior, Senior or recent graduate in an undergraduate education program; or currently enrolled in a graduate education program.
Basic knowledge of curriculum and instruction.
Strong working knowledge of Google Suite.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience using CRM databases or comfortable with new technology.
 How to Apply
To be considered, submit your resume, letter of interest, a writing sample, and your most recent transcript to Amanda Wanlass at amanda@indianaphenology.org

Close Date: April 15, 2021

title: Getty Marrow Education & Public Programs Internship
company: Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA)
requirements:
Description

The ten-week Getty Marrow internship in the Education and Public Programs department will provide an opportunity to engage in a broad range of LACMA's education programs for a variety of audiences. Major responsibilities will focus on collaborating with Education department staff to develop curriculum materials for Evenings for Educators, a professional development program for K-12 teachers focusing on LACMA's permanent collection, special exhibitions, or a pertinent issue for today's teachers and students. Also, the intern will contribute to our virtual programming for youth and families, including Art Camp and Andell Family Sundays Anytime.
This is a temporary, full-time, remote position.
Excellent computer and communication skills are required, and an art history, studio art, or arts education background is preferred.
Application Notes
* The completed internship application form and letters of recommendation should be sent directly to Lara Schilling at lschilling@lacma.org.*

title: Curriculum Development INTERNSHIP- International Education Course Content Scheduler
requirements:
International education organization seeks an INTERN for 8 weeks to work on annual curriculum development planning and execution with direct executive leadership.

In this role located in Tysons, VA you will work on content design in alignment with association requirements, prepare the calendar, set up the registration portal and schedule all advertising and social media for 2021.

Its a great opportunity to participate in a detailed project in the association, curriculum development and adult education areas.

Must be at least a sophomore in college working towards a related degree OR a re-entry candidate looking for experience necessary to update resume after taking time of of professional career path.

This internship requires in person work in Tysons a couple days a month. You must have excellent communications skills, have a working PC with access to Dropbox and strong skills with Excel, Word and Internet/social media research.

SDL2019-128

title: Publishing Curriculum Internship (Unpaid)
requirements:
Internship Description:
Assist adult curriculum editors with tasks including but not limited to: creating PowerPoint presentations; converting teacher SLC quarterly to student SLC quarterly.
Assist with a general curriculum assignments as needed.
Learn how to critique work flow and offer solutions to improve efficiency and brainstorm ways to refresh curriculum to appeal to a younger market.
Practice proofing curriculum materials, as assigned.
Internship Requirements:
Formal Education:  Completed college through Sophomore year.  English or Bible major/minor preferred but any major will be evaluated. 
Experience: N/A                     
Specialized Knowledge/Certification: Basic Bible knowledge, grammar and English language proficiency.
Equipment Knowledge:  Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Suite, especially InDesign (if possible, but not necessary)
Core Competencies: 
Self-starter
Communicates with ease
Organized
Likes responsibility
Self-screens work
Rational thinker
Understanding nature
Respects others
Contribute to a working environment of mutual Christian encouragement by upholding Christian standards in all working practices and relationships
Passion for Worship
Compensation Range:
Unpaid Internship, School credit if applicable
Benefits and Perks:
Company events (currently suspended due to COVID-19 pandemic)
Staff discounts
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the internship. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of learning opportunities and skills required of personnel so classified. David C Cook is a dynamic work environment where positions evolve and change. As a result, the Company reserves the right to modify, delete or add learning opportunities as necessary to benefit the learning experience of an intern. 
All requirements are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.
